comments.body:
Add to this docstring something like
> This module is intended only for internal use.  It will go away once the bundled copy of six includes equivalent functionality.  Third parties should not use this.
Oops, yes.  That's where I meant it to be

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1,5 @@# Copyright (c), Sviatoslav Sydorenko <ssydoren@redhat.com> 2018
# Simplified BSD License (see licenses/simplified_bsd.txt or https://opensource.org/licenses/BSD-2-Clause)
"""Collection of low-level utility functions."""

from __future__ import absolute_import, division, print_function

comments.body: I was wondering what was the reason to check for the `__ENCRYPTED__` attribute instead of `isinstance(..., AnsibleVaultEncryptedUnicode)` until I realized this is in module_utils and we can't import things from outside of module_utils.
